Name: Ominous Star
QuestDesc: Forbidden memories of the past lay buried in ashes and ruins. The ominous "fractured star" beckons, holding untold secrets within its shadows. Secrets that still burn within a cindered heart.

Unlock.Name: Listen to Animals' Words: Translation of Cat's Language
Investigate the Theft of Camp Supplies

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This must be the place...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I sensed something ominous from the leaf back there, but I couldn't pinpoint its source...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And now, the hatred and pain is so strong in this place. I don't even need to concentrate to feel it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, something terrible must have happened here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have to be cautious. This is a Tacet Field. Let's take out those Tacet Discords first.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think I've found something, Rover.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ritualistic wooden plaques...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why are they here? These plaques are usually placed in ancestral shrines...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And they seem to belong to a different time...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I remember reading about something like this. People held large-scale ancient rituals periodically in their villages, driven by certain beliefs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see... Let's check somewhere else.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh... Uh? Uhh...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something's not right. Why wouldn't it attack us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nngh... brother...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Help... Help...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Brother... help...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Help...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems to only repeat these lines... This is not a common Tacet Discord.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tacet Discords attack other living beings, because they need to feed on those frequencies to make themselves whole again. When frequencies are scattered and recombined, a new Tacet Discord is born.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This one probably devoured the frequencies of... humans.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Turning the last bits of a human's consciousness into such monotonous mumbles... Are these words the last cries of someone innocent? Who is behind this twisted plot?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-wait! It doesn't look like it's trying to attack us...

Options.PlotLineKey: Do Tacet Discords have consciousness too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Help...

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Brother...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems to only repeat these lines... This is not a common Tacet Discord.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tacet Discords attack other living beings, because they need to feed on those frequencies to make themselves whole again. When frequencies are scattered and recombined, a new Tacet Discord is born.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This one probably devoured the frequencies of... humans.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Turning the last bits of a human's consciousness into such monotonous mumbles... Are these words the last cries of someone innocent? Who is behind this twisted plot?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yangyang crouches down, hand on the Tacet Discord's head. As she focuses on the Streams, sorrow fills her expression.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You encounter an unusual Tacet Discord chirping out nonsensical phrases. Yangyang theorizes that it must have consumed a human frequency.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, that's beyond my ability. I just sensed some complex feelings from it... A mixture of deep sadness and eager anticipation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover... I think I know what's going on here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems to be begging for help, but it's not asking us to help it. I can sense the pained cries of this Tacet Discord... No, the cries of this whole village.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The village is crying, waiting for rescue.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something truly awful must have happened here... And the victims' Reverberations still linger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Based on the evidence we've found and the condition of these ruins, that didn't happen all too long ago. I can still feel it in the Streams.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps the Tacet Field has kept this village from being discovered, or maybe someone has been intentionally concealing it. Anyway...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There must be something we can do. We may find the victims nearby. I can feel someone connected to what happened here is still close... This place is dangerous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll inform Chixia about what happened here. Can we continue our search before the official investigators arrive?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, I know it doesn't sound very convincing... It's just a hunch of mine, and I don't have any evidence to back it up.

Options.PlotLineKey: No, not at all. I believe you.
This is where Jinhsi's token has pointed to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, Rover. Please stay vigilant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the little one here... Let's leave it be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yangyang can't communicate with the Tacet Discord, but she senses complex emotions flowing within it. A tragic event happened here not long ago, with danger surely lurking nearby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, that's beyond my ability. I just sensed some complex feelings from it... A mixture of deep sadness and eager anticipation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover... I think I know what's going on here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems to be begging for help, but it's not asking us to help it. I can sense the pained cries of this Tacet Discord... No, the cries of this whole village.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The village is crying, waiting for rescue.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something truly awful must have happened here... And the victims' Reverberations still linger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Based on the evidence we've found and the condition of these ruins, that didn't happen all too long ago. I can still feel it in the Streams.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps the Tacet Field has kept this village from being discovered, or maybe someone has been intentionally concealing it. Anyway...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There must be something we can do. We may find the victims nearby. I can feel someone connected to what happened here is still close... This place is dangerous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll inform Chixia about what happened here. Can we continue our search before the official investigators arrive?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, I know it doesn't sound very convincing... It's just a hunch of mine, and I don't have any evidence to back it up.

Options.PlotLineKey: No, not at all. I believe you.
This is where Jinhsi's token has pointed to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, Rover. Please stay vigilant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for the little one here... Let's leave it be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yangyang can't communicate with the Tacet Discord, but she senses complex emotions flowing within it. A tragic event happened here not long ago, with danger surely lurking nearby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The area's a mess, but it doesn't look like a warzone. Someone was hurt and dragged away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, there are many footprints here. These are... traces left by a fight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Someone was injured...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These cards... I see...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus is likely behind it all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. I don't know much about the Fractsidus, but as an Outrider, I've worked on related cases.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a group of extremists obsessed with fusing humans with Tacet Discords. They've caused terror attacks of various scales around the world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fusing humans and Tacet Discords...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've seen signs of their presence in Jinzhou, left by lower-ranked members called "Artificers".

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Above the Artificers are the Overseers, leaders with eerie abilities and unknown intentions. They pose a far bigger threat...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No one knows their true intentions. Some members speak of world destruction, while others claim they seek eternal power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And there is one particularly insane Overseer. He's crazy even by the Fractsidus's standards...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A man who sees no order and revels in destruction... I've seen similar cards in the physical evidence file of the Fractsidus-related cases.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They belonged to this one Overseer I'm talking about. They call him... Scar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If he's responsible for what happened to these villagers... Who knows what kind of cruel and twisted atrocities he's capable of...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From cards discovered at the scene, Yangyang deduces that the tragedy is likely the work of the Fractsidus, an extremist group obsessed with merging humans and Tacet Discords. The cards belong to Scar, one of the organization's Overseers.

Chapters.Title: Investigate where the weird noises are coming from

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Guess you won't need my self-introduction. Aww, I spent so much time on it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Following the surprise attack, Yangyang disappears and a mysterious man clad in red appears in front of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you need to hear it from me, then... Yes, I am Scar.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Cruel and twisted maniac."

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We deserve a meeting free of such disturbances, don't you agree?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That girl... She's gonna sway your judgment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aw, so you really care about her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, I don't plan to make you hate me just yet... She is safe now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, let's just enjoy our time together for the moment. Forget about that irrelevant person, will you? I have a lot to share with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To begin with... I heard you've lost your memories?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So it's true.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That makes sense, given how fragile you were when you woke up. Or I would've questioned the authenticity of those rumors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you noticed? Aww, I'm flattered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No need to be so on edge. By now you should've realized I'm just one of the onlookers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But out of all the onlookers, I'm the only one who came forward to meet you, with absolute honesty.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe... Indeed. I'll tell you then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before you knew anything about this world, you were already the center of conflict.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are the unknown variable we've been waiting for. Forces have been fighting for possession over you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From the moment you opened your eyes, everyone you've met, including that girl you care so much about... They all knew how valuable you are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The world is a cruel place. You are a living, breathing person, but you're just a pawn to many.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why I'm here... Because I see you as a dear friend, and I want to tell you the truth. I am so, so sorry for everything you are about to face.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But truth hurts sometimes.

Options.PlotLineKey: As if you were any different.
You're just trying to make me join your side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, I know you are not one I can sway with simple words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You could say I'm looking forward to your choice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My goal is simple. I just want to deepen our mutual understanding, nothing more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come on. Observe the surroundings a little more, and tell me what you see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you learn more about this world, your true desires will surface, and our little game will become... even more entertaining.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And before that, I don't want anyone to disturb my precious alone time with you... That's all.

Options.PlotLineKey: What did the Fractsidus do to this village?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aww. Why do you have to assume we are the culprits?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe you should be asking me what actually happened here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I won't tell you everything just yet. That's too boring. As I said, why don't you take a look around and see for yourself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So. Go ahead, what do you see?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bravo! Didn't think you'd catch on to that!

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, what is the conclusion you've drawn?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, how typical. The age-old tale of savage wolves and helpless lambs. Good and evil as clear as day. It's a tired story that people cling to in their mundane lives. Oh, how it keeps them in check.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But let me ask you this: do you truly believe the real world can be that simple?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see you don't really trust those villagers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... So they were right about you. You are indeed quite exceptional.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I like it. Your keen observation, precise judgment, and accurate understanding of human nature...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me give you a couple more tips.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The truth is far more complicated than you think.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: First, who are the players in our tale?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An innocent girl, a revered leader, and a flock of simple villagers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Next, what makes up our main plot?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: False devotion, fleeting kindness, collective deceit, senseless killings, and... The one vulnerable soul, pushed onto a path of destruction by the masses.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, Rover, the story is yours to spin.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm eager to hear your version after you've learned more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mysterious man, whose name is Scar, doesn't attack you. He invites you to investigate the village with your own eyes to uncover the truths beneath the surface.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? What is it? Are you back for some chit-chat?

Options.PlotLineKey: Just tell me the truth. All of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. So you want to cheat, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A clever move, unbound by convention. I like it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I'm not telling you more. Not yet. Wouldn't want our first conversation to become a boring exchange of words, just parroting each other's lines.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahahaha... No. I refuse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and don't try to threaten me. You're not in a place to bargain, remember?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't want to disappoint me so soon, Rover.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: C'mon. No need to get so worked up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see you're itching for a fight, but our game isn't over yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strike now and risk being crippled. And what a shame it would be to miss out on these crucial clues right in front of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After all this effort, do you truly want to throw it all away?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aww, are you seriously going to judge me off of those rumors alone?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I knew it... Gentle lambs like me are bound to suffer. Never given a chance to speak for ourselves...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well then, I suppose I'll have to be a little more ruthless with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Play nice and go investigate the clues in this village, then I might show your girl some "gratitude" for leaving us be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Otherwise... You may have to bid her farewell. Forever.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you say?

Options.PlotLineKey: Shut up and fight me properly!

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: HAHAHAHA! You never cease to amaze me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such a burning desire for battle... How could I have the heart to decline?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you wish, then...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You demand the truth, but Scar refuses. Clearly, revealing it to you directly holds no thrills for him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, the water is going down!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A crumpled page from a children's book rests on a torn piece of diary paper with childish handwriting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our story begins here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once upon a time, in a peaceful village lived a flock of carefree lambs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the day they toiled for food, and when evening fell, they sought refuge from the looming threat of wolves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fables, stories told and retold through the ages. The ancient art of conveying hidden truths through fiction.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But they always draw from real life, don't they?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The same story gets told by many, and each person brings their own spin, their own focus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whatever you learn from it is just one of countless different interpretations.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Like us now, caught in a carefully crafted plot line... A scheme I had no hand in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This village marks the beginning of my story with Jinzhou... Hehe...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So that Magistrate led you here to meet me. Heh, such a clever move on her part.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find a diary page that once belonged to a little girl, a wanderer who finally found refuge in this village. The entries hint at unsettling truths. Scar, with an air of detachment, shares a fable of wolves and sheep.

Chapters.Title: Follow the TD to find more clues
Investigate places where the TD stayed

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The tree branches are loaded with paper slips, each containing someone's wish. The words on most of the notes are soaked and no longer legible.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Another crumpled page from a children's book, half-buried in the mud.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day, a shepherd visited the village.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The shepherd brought them promises of abundance and protection. The lambs, drawn in by his words, soon lived in comfort and security...

Options.PlotLineKey: Is that... the end of your story?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nope, quite the opposite! The shepherd's arrival is only the beginning.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With a wave of his hand, the shepherd could grant their every wish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: His flock obeyed, bowing their heads, pleading for better food and shelter.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They no longer had to struggle for survival, as their once meager lives were replaced with endless luxury.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The flock worshipped their shepherd-turned-god, praising him and holding him in the highest regard...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's wrong? Does my story make you uncomfortable?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Imagine you were one of those lambs, facing irresistible temptation and pressure from your peers. Wouldn't you bow down and beg for food from your master?

Options.PlotLineKey: We are all created equal. There should be no hierarchy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha... So we agree already.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are right, but the world we live in falls short of our ideals. The shepherd still reigns, and the lambs have grown complacent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's up to the two of us to make that ideal world a reality.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find more notes. Scar continues with his tale about a shepherd providing for the lambs in exchange for their loyalty. He asks whether you would bow to authority to get what you want. You tell him that all are equal.

Chapters.Title: Follow the TD to find more clues
Investigate places where the TD stayed

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A crumpled page from a children's book, silently resting on the ground.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The lambs reveled in endless bonfire parties, celebrating their new god every night, except... the one little black lamb.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As each night passed, it was the only one to notice how its flock was dwindling away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, do you think someone would give you what you want without taking anything from you?

Options.PlotLineKey: I believe in quid pro quo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I once believed that too. Thought as long as I paid a high enough price, I could get my desired outcome.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But true equality is scarce. Always has been.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The world was never a fair place. Wouldn't you agree?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To receive equal retribution, one must give more, and more... and more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When every wish comes with a hefty price, people weigh their options carefully.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But when they can make someone else bear the price...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They all rush to make more wishes. They don't consider they too may one day pay for another's selfish desire.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Funny, isn't it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your investigation continues. The tragedy that befell the village starts to unravel and Scar persists in trying to sway your judgment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave? Do you want to leave here? Are you asking me to leave?

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave... Me...

Chapters.Title: Follow the TD to find more clues
Investigate places where the TD stayed

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You find some markings on the walls.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you lean in closer to look, you notice some faint markings on the wall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Words like "MONSTER", "WITCH", "BANISH HER" and "ALL HER FAULT" are written thickly on the wall.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A crumpled page from a children's book, silently resting on the ground.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Later, the shepherd openly blamed the black lamb for the flock's decline.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On the next day, the white lambs welcomed the rising sun as usual, but the black lamb was nowhere to be found.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The shepherd introduced an unspoken rule to this village, one that our black lamb violated by telling the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Suddenly, the once doting "god" stopped fulfilling wishes, because no more sacrifices were being made.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After witnessing the black lamb's actions, and hearing from their almighty shepherd... What do you suppose the white lambs did?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, those oblivious lambs. Little did they know, the most fearsome demon was right under their noses.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After gathering all the clues, you learn that the black lamb who told the truth about the shepherd met with a tragic fate. The white lambs sacrificed it to continue to have their wishes fulfilled.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A red demon... Is it Scar?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I had known what I had to pay for making wishes... I've been lied to! We've been lied to!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's all that girl's fault! Her horrifying power... She's a witch...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This girl mentioned here... Is she the black lamb in that story?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to this map and the clues we've gathered so far, the ritual may have happened underground...

Chapters.Title: Tell Scar your theory of what had happened

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well done. You didn't let any detail slip.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, I wonder. What is your takeaway from this story?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Answer me, and I'll reveal the truth of what happened.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who was the real culprit behind the diminishing number of lambs?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed, the direct culprit was the shepherd.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He held all the power, fulfilling wishes at a price. The lambs knew the risks, yet succumbed to temptation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Unfortunately, in the face of such temptation, they disregarded all the hidden risks, as disaster had yet to befall them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If they were given another chance... I believe they would still choose the same path.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Inevitably, they accepted their fate and paid the price when their time came.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Brilliant answer. You saw past the obvious.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The true culprit was not the shepherd, but the white lambs who chose to follow his rules.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The shepherd never forced them into anything. He merely presented a choice, a possibility.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No one would have been killed if they simply refrained from making those wishes. Their greed and indifference were the cause of it all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? So you're siding with the white lambs, blaming it all on the one who challenged the status quo?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha... But in another version of this story, the black lamb got to unleash its vengeful wrath upon the flock and the shepherd, eventually becoming the new rule-maker.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that the kind of ending you were hoping to hear?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, my second question: What price did the lambs pay for their wishes?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, as always. Life was the most valuable thing they had to offer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But that's what they wanted in the first place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why would they trade their wealth for a wish, when they were risking lives for it anyway?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They must have poured their sincerity into it, no doubt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But that's not much of a price, is it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here's my final question... What happened to the black lamb?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nuh uh... Don't rush, Rover. Take your time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is the truth you've uncovered?

Options.PlotLineKey: It was murdered by its flock and the shepherd.
It was executed because its flock was deceived.
It survived along with all the other lambs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The shepherd was granting wishes by sacrificing the lives of lambs. The flock found out the truth but chose to be his accomplices, and they willingly offered the black lamb as another sacrifice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha, that's right!

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The shepherd was granting wishes by sacrificing the lives of lambs. The flock never found out about it. They were deceived into believing the black lamb was the culprit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Almost there, Rover.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The shepherd was granting wishes by sacrificing the lives of lambs. The flock never found out about it. Someone came to their rescue, and they all made it out alive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pfft... Really? You're such a good little lamb. So innocent, so sweet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you really believe a hero would show up and save the day?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You conclude that the white lambs succumbed to temptation despite knowing the cost of their wishes, while the black lamb was sacrificed for revealing the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Little lambs cowered and huddled in their village, terrified of the relentless wolf packs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Until a shepherd arrived, bearing the gift of wishes and providing shelter and sustenance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Slowly, the shepherd gained control over the flock, and the lambs lived contented lives... but this is not the end of our story.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The shepherd found the solitary black lamb in his flock, and offered to grant any wish it desired. In exchange, he wanted one of its companions as a sacrifice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The black lamb refused, and it was shunned by its flock, left without shelter or sustenance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After the black lamb's exile, more lambs continued to vanish...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The shepherd then blamed that black lamb for breaking the rules, and withheld his wish-granting power as punishment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From the very beginning, the lambs knew the risk of making wishesthey too could become sacrifices for those of others.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But they always believed it wouldn't be them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Meanwhile, some lambs reasoned that since they had already risked being sacrificed for someone else's wish...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was then only fair to pass on that risk for a chance at fulfilling their own desires. And so, they continued to play the game.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They all knew the consequences, but chose to remain silent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fearful yet greedy, they followed the shepherd's orders and made wishes again and again...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Until one day a brave black lamb spoke up, shattering their faade of a peaceful and happy life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The black lamb got in their way and the shepherd's greedy pursuit, sparking hatred in their hearts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Suddenly, they could no longer ignore the blood and ashes of past sacrifices littering the ground.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How do you like my story, Rover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What really happened here? I suppose you already have it figured out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The black lamb who rebelled against the rules, and the white lambs who succumbed to their greed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The innocent maiden sacrificed, and the villagers who turned on each other in a ruthless frenzy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...They had it coming.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All the shepherd had to do was execute the rebel. That's how he kept the flock in check and maintained the status quo.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is that why you became a "shepherd" yourself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fun answer, but no. Not even close.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was never the "shepherd". Never will be. You and I... We are the "black lamb", the one who breaks the rules.

Options.PlotLineKey: "He who fights too long against dragons becomes a dragon himself."

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha... Interesting, Rover! I'm liking you more and more!

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well then. Let's see if this black lamb is going to end up like you say!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Scar reveals the moral of the tale he has spun for you. He believes himself to be the rule-breaking black lamb. It is clear where his allegiances lie, and you decide you have heard enough...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, the water is going down!

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome to the realm of endless chaos...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now is your time to think, Rover. What is the right path to take?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? You've found us already?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shake and shiver, blink an eye, a flock of lambs come passing by.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fleece of white, black and red, who's the sweetest one ahead?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch out, my dear. Your pioneers are lying at your feet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't look back. Join them on this right path, and I've got a scorchingly delightful welcome for you up ahead!

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh-oh, don't rush. One slip... and you'll shatter to pieces.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Such speed, such brutality... Aah, can't you see? We are kindred spirits, after all...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shh... Don't be so quick to deny it. Now that I have you here, standing before me, I'd love to hear your answers...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tell me. Do you want to be the rule-setting shepherd, or the rule-breaking black lamb?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If a sane person manages to survive in a realm of lunatics, would you call them the last one of reason... or the sole apostle?

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Think about it. The shepherd is not the preordained embodiment of truth. Once he is gone for good, the black lamb can reclaim the trust of its herd...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then... eventually, there will be none left to be "victims" or "oppressors"!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Rover!

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, such a pesky girl.

Chapters.Title: Defeat Scar and break out of his Elysium

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover... Rover!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I shattered Scar's illusion. That should've injured him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, should I thank you for showing me mercy?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stay away from {Male=him;Female=her}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh. Didn't you promise to leave me some alone time with Rover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mysterious Woman in Red
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With one condition. I do hope you haven't let that slip from your mind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mysterious Woman in Red
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't let your improvisation trouble others.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh... Look at you, rushing in to protect your precious "Perfect Movement".

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No worries. I know all the dos and don'ts. I don't need you to tell me what to do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, it seems our happy little date... must come to an end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But don't forget my sincere reminders.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me know what you'll choose: an unexpected gift, an honest and open exchange, or a highly risky gamble...

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The choice is yours. I know how smart you are. You won't make a hasty decision.

Dialogues.Speaker: Scar
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll meet again... in the not-too-distant future.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They are gone. Should we go after them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... Don't worry. I'm okay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Scar's Resonance Abilities appear to involve teleportation and the manipulation of space. He trapped me in confinement, and I could only sense that it wasn't far from here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It took me some time to break that barrier. Sorry, Rover, if only I could've reached you sooner...

Options.PlotLineKey: You are safe now, and that's all I care.
I broke free from it all thanks to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: B-brother... Brother...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eh? Why are you here, little one?

Options.PlotLineKey: It probably hid out of fear.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've never seen any Tacet Discord display such vivid emotions...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The 'brother' it mentioned... Could it be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, that is a possibility, since Scar had been here before...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's talk about it later. Rover, can you fill me in on what happened?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You tell Yangyang about what just happened and the leads you gathered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems all the tragedies in Qichi Village were linked to that "ritual...

Options.PlotLineKey: ...And Scar was feeding me bits of info.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Making up stories based on real life to support his twisted beliefs... That does sound like something he might do...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We cannot take his words for granted. Now we must locate where the "ritual" took place and see for ourselves.

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, we should give it a check.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm? What's the matter?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Two distinct frequencies of Tacet Discords... I see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can feel it in the Streams... Over there. Follow me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (In the south...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They are unharmed. Please rest assured.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you anticipated, Scar did not try to kill them... Yes, I stayed out of it like you asked.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is everything alright on your end?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sanhua
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Please be sure to stay safe, My Lady.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After Scar's defeat, a mysterious woman in red comes to his aid. You share the events with Yangyang and realize that you need to find the actual location of Scar's tale to determine its truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, do you still have the plaque we found earlier? The one broken in half.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, as I thought... I just felt a similar vibration from that direction. Please follow me.

Chapters.Title: Head to the direction Yangyang pointed to

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the missing half... We can piece them together now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You placed the wooden plaque on the stone. Soon after, you heard the roaring of flowing water.

Chapters.Title: Activate the mechanism with the complete Wooden Plaque

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, the water is going down!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where did it go...?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that a... diary?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't believe it... There's such a big opening down here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How odd... This place should have been soaked in water, but everything is dry here. Even the vegetation is thriving.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did Scar do this? Given his powers, it doesn't seem too hard for him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That tree... It's stunning. It's almost eerily enchanting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Strange Tacet Discord
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please... Save us...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you trying to tell us about... something hidden here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where did it go...?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that a... diary?

Chapters.Title: Investigate the diary pages under the tree

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That girl just wanted to save her village...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But those sacrifices didn't lead to redemption.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I guess the Tacet Discord we saw stayed here to convey her last wishes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Please excuse me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's getting a bit too cold here... Can we head back now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, Rover. I didn't feel comfortable down there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The air was heavy in that place, without any wind to speak of, but I could still feel so many emotions and desperate cries for help... I... I couldn't handle it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The villagers were a complex mix of emotions... hope, resentment, and despair. And as I read the diary, I could feel the intense sorrow and longing of its owner.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What was the diary's owner longing for? Was it the peaceful life she once had, or did she miss her only familythe person who pushed her towards such tragic end?

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...My apologies. I got lost in thoughts again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wish I could say such tragedies won't happen again...

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...But I still lack the confidence to make that claim.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was tragedies like this that made me want to become an Outrider... to become someone with the strength to stop them from ever happening again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I cannot stop the Lament, but at least I should do everything in my power to help those affected by it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? Thank you... Rover.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dwelling on it won't do us any good... Let's go. I'll compile a report on what had happened here, and send it in along with the clues we've gathered.

Dialogues.Speaker: Yangyang
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Let's go back... together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your adventure in Qichi Village concludes. As an Outrider tasked with keeping the peace, Yangyang is deeply saddened by the village's tragedy. With all the clues gathered, it is time you return to the city.
